agency_project_description: Gut renovation of existing Officers lockers and toilet and shower facilities to provide new lockers, new fixtures and interior finishes including lighting and renovated HVAC systems and other items as needed.  The flowing Officer and Senior Officer Locker Rooms will be renovated:  Locker Room Type          Male Officer    Female Officer                Sr. Male Officer              Sr. Female Officer          Male Dep Warden          Female Dep Warden                                                     Furthermore, the following work types have been identified: New Lockers Replace existing wall, floor and ceiling finishes.       Renovate finishes in Toilet Shower Areas Replace Plumbing Fixtures and Toilet Accessories Replace lighting throughout with LED lighting Renovate Ventilation/HVAC system  Justification: It was  determined that the current structures, and infrastructure that supports the buildings, located on Rikers Island requires immediate renovations and rehabilitation, and without any design and construction solutions, these structures will continue to endanger the health of the occupants.  This critical and necessary work is needed immediately to provide a safe, clean environment on Rikers Island. The renovation work proposed for the  Anna M. Kross Center (AMKC), is to address the deplorable locker room condition at this facility. The Locker room is in dire need of renovation and is long overdue. This renovation will offer a better working environment for officers which may also improve the officers moral.
delay_desc: PROJECT DELAYED DUE TO CHANGES IN SCOPE/DESIGN

agency_project_description: Arcady Road Reconstruction
delay_desc: PROJECT DELAYED DUE TO BUDGETARY CONSTRAINTS
scope_text: ARCADY ROAD IS LOCATED IN WESTCHESTER COUNTY, NY ADJACENT TO THE CROTON RESERVOIR. THIS CONSTRUCTION CONTRACT IS FOR THE RECONSTRUCTION OF APPROXIMATELY 1 MILE OF ROADWAY AND REPLACEMENT/RECONSTRUCTION OF ALL DRAINAGE CULVERTS AND GUIDE RAILING.  A PORTION OF THE EXISTING ROADWAY IS COLLAPSED (DUE TO TROPICAL STORM FLOYD IN 1999) AND THE ROAD IS CURRENTLY CLOSED TO TRAFFIC.  THIS SECTION OF ROADWAY WILL NEED TO BE RECONSTRUCTED AND STABILIZED.

agency_project_description: The new Mosholu Golf Course Club House, together with fifty-five Driving Range Tee Boxes and ten-acres of re-landscaping comprise the phase IV and final of the vast DEP Croton Water Treatment Plant project, currently under construction in Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx. Through a multifunctional design strategy the project reinstates the pre-existing golf program and facility, creates civic space for community use and ensures security for a multi-billion dollar public works facility.

agency_project_description: Replacement of two (2) 42dia cone valves and two (2) 60 butterfly valves located on the north and south line within the valve chamber of the EDRC in Downsville.  The 2 cone valves require replacement to isolate the polyjet regulating Valves.  The butterfly valves require replacement due to lack of closure & leakage.  Also included will be replacement of the Polyjet Valve Actuators and the 20 Gate Valve on the Conservation Line.  The valve replacements require the EDRC to be isolated, shutdown and bypassed.  The two (2) 42x60 Venturi on the North & South Release Line and 12x20 venturi on the Conservation Line are to be removed, inspected, refurbished, and reinstalled.
delay_desc: PROJECT DELAYED DUE TO BUDGETARY CONSTRAINTS

agency_project_description: Replacement of two (2) 42dia cone valves and two (2) 60 butterfly valves located on the north and south line within the valve chamber of the EDRC in Downsville.  The 2 cone valves require replacement to isolate the polyjet regulating Valves.  The butterfly valves require replacement due to lack of closure & leakage.  Also included will be replacement of the Polyjet Valve Actuators and the 20 Gate Valve on the Conservation Line.  The valve replacements require the EDRC to be isolated, shutdown and bypassed.  The two (2) 42x60 Venturi on the North & South Release Line and 12x20 venturi on the Conservation Line are to be removed, inspected, refurbished, and reinstalled.
delay_desc: PROJECT DELAYED DUE TO BUDGETARY CONSTRAINTS
scope_text: REPLACEMENT OF RELEASE CHAMER VALVE AT EAST DELAWARE.

agency_project_description: Design and construct a new double-company fire house in conformance to FDNY design standards and space program. With a programmed area of 13,304 square feet, and an additional need for exterior parking to accommodate 12 vehicles, this facility will replace the old fire house (located at 2-59 Beach 116th Street) which is outdated, inadequate, and was severely damaged during the super storm Sandy of October 2012.

agency_project_description: Replacement of Shore (Belt) Parkway Bridge over Mill Basin, Brooklyn.The project consists of the removal of the existing fourteen (14) span bascule bridge (length 864 feet) and replacement with a seventeen (17) span fixed bridge (length 2,645 feet) elevated to provide a 60 foot vertical clearance over the navigational channel. The typical bridge section consists of a composite concrete deck and steel superstructure supported on a reinforced concrete substructure on concrete piles. The new bridge will be constructed on a new alignment set on the north side of the existing bridge, partially overlapping with the existing bridge. The new bridge and approach roadways will provide three (3) 12 foot wide lanes for vehicular traffic, a 12 foot wide right shoulder on the bridge and a 10 foot wide right shoulder on the approach roadways, a minimum 4 foot wide left shoulder in each direction, and a 12 foot wide bicycle / pedestrian facility adjacent to the eastbound roadway. Substandard stopping sight distance for the bridge and approach roadways will be eliminated.  The design speed for the bridge and approach roadways is 60 MPH (100 KMPH). Necessary upland and wetland mitigation work will be performed.
delay_desc: PROJECT DELAYED DUE TO BUDGETARY CONSTRAINTS
scope_text: RECONSTRUCTION AND REHABILITATION OF THE MILL BASIN BR/ BELT PARKWAY BREPLACEMENT OF DECK INCLUSIVE OF ANY INCIDENTAL STEEL WORK, CURBS ANDSIDEWALKS THE FUNDING FOR THIS PROJECT IS ALL CITY

agency_project_description: Bronx Animal Care Center & Veterinary Clinic is a new 50,000 SF facility that will be housing admissions, adoptions, medical services, and boarding for approximately 70 dogs, 140 cats, 30 rabbits and other species to be determined. Support spaces will include spaces focused on animal caretakers & visitors including offices, restrooms, storage & areas of respite. Integrated with the architecture, the open areas on the site will include a visitor entrance plaza, courtyards to facilitate animal adoptions, enrichment & training spaces for animals, and parking for staff, visitors, and animal transportation vehicles, as well as site lighting and low-maintenance native planting throughout. In addition to the animal housing, the Bronx Animal Care Center will include a community space for academic partnership for youth and enhanced senior services. The building and associated landscape are to achieve LEED Silver standards or higher.

agency_project_description: The Scope of work includes management of final design, procurement and construction of pedestrian safety improvements at the following 4 schools in the Bronx, P.S. 85/ I.S 218, P.S. 307 and Rosalyn Yalow Charter school. Each school should have its own bid items along with the total cost. DOT consultant has completed the preliminary design and will develop the final designs, as well as seeking community board approvals for P.S/I.S 218, P.S. 307 and Rosalyn Yalow Charter school.. DOT has received approvals from Community Board #5 & b6 (attached) for P.S. 85. DDC and consultant must review the attach draft CPI comments including all the additional design considerations recommended, during the final design phase.

agency_project_description: Green infrastructure will be constructed along one block of 112th Avenue, between 177th Street and 178th Street, and along 177th Street, between Sayres Avenue and Murdock Avenue. The section on 112th will include a large, connected stormwater Greenstreet combined with underground storage via infiltration basins. The section on 177th street will include a combination of bioswales and infiltration basins. This project will include DOT-funded roadway grading and street geometry changes.

agency_project_description: This project has been initiated to bring three identified utility trenches in SI to a state of good repair. These sites, pulled from a master list, were prioritized with attention to ratings data, field observations, and community needs. The sites are split into scoping categories; full street reconstruction, and trench restoration with resurfacing. Projects will upgrade pedestrian facilities to ADA compliancy, and address adjacent capital assets in poor condition (curbs, sidewalks, and others as needed). SER002333 IS A SUB-PROJECT TO HWTRR1.

agency_project_description: RECONSTRUCTION OF THE HENWOOD PLACE STEP STREET. THIS STREET IS CURRENTLY IN STATE OF DISREPAIR AND IS SUBJECT OF FREQUENT COMPLAINTS TO DOT. THE STEPS ON HENWOOD PLACE ARE HIGHLY INEVEN DUE TO SOIL EROSION AND SINKING LANDINGS AND THE STREETS IS BESET BY SIGNIFICANT DRAINAGE ISSUES AND CHRONIC PONDING. THIS PROJECT WILL FULLY RECONSTRUCT THE HENWOOD PLACE STEP STREEET, BRINGING IT UP TO GOOD REPAIR , CREATE SAFER TRAVEL CONDITIONS .

agency_project_description: This Vision Zero capital project will construct pedestrian safety-focused geometric improvements at threeintersections in the southern Bronx. The project scope includes two bus bulbs on Westchester Avenue below the Prospect Avenue 2/5 subway station, four additional curb extensions, and streetscape improvements. All three locations in this capital project have received successful operational treatments introduced via StreetImprovement Projects (SIPs). Capital construction will permanently improve safety conditions at theseintersections for all street users by shortening crossing distances, calming traffic, increasing pedestrian visibility, and controlling vehicle turning movements.

Streetscape design component of this project includes reconstruction of numerous Bus Stops Under the El which will include installation of a new transit node furnishing called the CityEl. The CityEl is in design and this will be part of the pilot launch. This project will require coordination with MTA.

agency_project_description: The retaining wall along the segment of Pratt Avenue (Needham Ave to Dead End) shows multiple signs of damage. This includes cracking (long cracks run the entire height of the wall) and movement of the individual elements of the wall. The cracks and movement of the wall has allowed the backfill that supports the roadway to escape. The roadway within the project limits has experienced significant damage due to settlement of supporting materials. The proposed scope includes reconstruction of the roadway and retaining wall along this segment.

agency_project_description: Reconstruction of East 169th Street Step Street between Clay and Webster
delay_desc: PROJECT DELAYED DUE TO BUDGETARY CONSTRAINTS
scope_text: RECONSTRUCTION OF THE E 169TH STREET STEP STREET

agency_project_description: This capital project will address the East 169th Street step streets substandard condition through full reconstruction of the project area. Consistent with other step street projects, the design consultant for this project shall provide several design alternatives for the project limits, with attention paid to maximizing accessibility, public space, functionality, and streetscape amenities (street trees, seating, etc.) within the right of way. DOT acknowledges that many of these priorities are competing for limited space within this constrained project site, and that the different alternatives will prioritize these competing interests differently.DOTs preliminary accessibility analysis suggests that a combination of ADA accessible ramps and staircases are feasible within the project limits (see this documents conceptual design attachment for a proof of concept). This scale diagram establishes that there is sufficient space for a ramp structure within the project limits. DDC shall direct the design consultant to explore various ramp and stair configurations during preliminary design and identify any technical challenges associated with their construction. If, after reviewing the design alternatives, it is determined only stairway accessibility can be provided, any technical infeasibility or other constraint that limits building to full ADA requirements must be fully documented and added to the project file. The documentation must, at a minimum, clearly lay out the issue, describe the efforts taken to rectify the issue, and explain why the final design was chosen to be selected.
delay_desc: PROJECT DELAYED DUE TO BUDGETARY CONSTRAINTS
scope_text: RECONSTRUCTION OF THE E 169TH STREET STEP STREET

agency_project_description: RECONSTRUCTION OF DAVIDSON AVE STEP STREET, BRONX. THE PROJECT WILL PERFORM A REPLACEMENT-IN-KIND OF THE DAVIDSON AVE STEP ST. LOCATED AT DAVIDSON AVE BETWEEN FEATHERBED LANE AND WEST 174TH ST. THE GRANITE STEPS ARE HIGHLY UNEVEN DUE TO EROSION AND ARE AT RISK OF DESTABILIZING THE STRUCTURE. THE JOINTS ARE IN POOR CONDITION WITH CRACKING, SPALLING AND SURROUNDING VOIDS. PORTIONS OF THE EXISTING RAILINGS ARE MISSING OR HAVE DISCONNECTED FROM THE BASE. THE PURPOSE OF THIS RECONSTRUCTION PROJECT IS TO PERFORM A REPLACEMENT-IN-KIND OF THE STEP STREET.

agency_project_description: Corridor improvements to include pedestrian experience under the elevated 4 train that runs above Jerome Avenue plus final design for the following three sites: Jerome Ave at Burnside, Jerome Ave at Tremont Ave, and 170th Street/Keltch Park. This project will also take the remaining sites through both preliminary and final design. Streetscape design component of this project includes reconstruction of numerous Bus Stops Under the El which will include installation of a new transit node furnishing called the CityEl. The CityEl is in design and this will be part of the pilot launch. This project will require coordination with MTA.

agency_project_description: The Scope of work includes management of final design, procurement and construction of pedestrian safety improvements at the following 4 schools in the Bronx, P.S. 85/ I.S 218, P.S. 307 and Rosalyn Yalow Charter school. Each school should have its own bid items along with the total cost. DOT consultant has completed the preliminary design and will develop the final designs, as well as seeking community board approvals for P.S/I.S 218, P.S. 307 and Rosalyn Yalow Charter school.. DOT has received approvals from Community Board #5 & b6 (attached) for P.S. 85. DDC and consultant must review the attach draft CPI comments including all the additional design considerations recommended, during the final design phase.

agency_project_description: The scope of this project is the creation of approximately 73,320 square feet of space in a free-standing multi-level tower connected by bridges at third floor of the existing Crossroads building. The addition will house a warehouse, health care service, admission and transportation, education and vocation classrooms and workshops, and critical HVAC infrastructure to serve the new and existing facility, and miscellaneous support spaces. It is proposed the structure will be built on the south-west portion of the site.

agency_project_description: The scope of this project is the creation of approximately 72,500 square feet of space in a free-standing multi-level tower connected by bridges at the second floor of the existing Horizon building. The addition will house a commercial kitchen, dining hall, health care service, warehouse, education and vocation classrooms and workshops, and critical HVAC infrastructure to serve the new building and the existing facility, and miscellaneous support spaces. It is proposed the structure will be built on the north-east portion of the site.

agency_project_description: The Horizon Juvenile Detention Center Annex project consists of three phases, spread out in order to achieve minimal disruption to the operations of the existing Horizon Juvenile Center. Phase 1  Elevated Recreation Platform and Related Work  31,000 GSF. A new elevated recreation platform above the existing loading area without impeding on its function.  The elevated recreation platform will replace the existing recreation space designated for the construction of the Annex building. Phase 2  Annex Building and Related Work  75,000 GSF. A new Annex building consisting of program space to support 48 beds of housing, 8 special needs unit beds, medical, education, kitchen, and facility support. Phase 3  At-Grade Recreation, Fencing and Related Work  17,325 GSF. Reconfiguration of the remaining open space on the lot for additional open recreation space.

agency_project_description: North River WWTP Cogeneration and Electrification
delay_desc: PROJECT DELAYED DUE TO BUDGETARY CONSTRAINTS
scope_text: BASED ON THE FEBRUARY 2012 INVESTMENT GRADE FEASIBILITY STUDY FOR COGENERATION AT THE NORTH RIVER WWTP IT HAS BEEN IDENTIFIED THAT ELECTRIFICATION OF THE PLANT AND INSTALLATION OF COGENERATION FACILITIES SHOULD BE PURSUED TO IMPROVE OPERATIONS AND RELIABILITY, REDUCE GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS, AND PROVIDE COST EFFECTIVE SOLUTIONS OVER THE EXISTING ENGINE DRIVEN PUMP AND BLOWER SYSTEMS. THE MOST COST EFFECTIVE ALTERNATIVE FOR COGENERATION AT THE NORTH RIVER WWTP IS THE 10 MW COGENERATION

"PARKS INSPECTIONS HAVE IDENTIFIED SAFETY CONDITIONS RELATED TO THE RANAQUA STOREHOUSE  AT THE DISPATCH OFFICE AND  BATHROOM AREAS, RESULTING IN CLOSURE OF BOTH THESE FACILITIES. THE CLOSURE OF THE DISPATCH OFFICE HAS RELOCATED STAFF AWAY FROM THE CENTER OF THE COMPOUND, RESULTING IN REDUCED ABILITY TO SURVEIL THE AREA. CONSEQUENTLY, THERE HAS BEEN AN INCREASE IN TRESPASSERS AND STOLEN MATERIAL IN THE AREA. 
IF THE EXISTING CONDITION AND UNDERLYING CAUSES ARE NOT ADDRESSED, STRUCTURE WILL FACE CONTINUED DETERIORATION. THIS WILL RESULT IN EXPANDING THE AREA AND FACILITIES THAT ARE CLOSED OFF DUE TO INCREASED RISK TO HEALTHAND SAFETY. WATER INFILTRATION WILL CONTINUE TO CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE FAADE, AND MAY EVENTUALLY POSE A RISK TO OTHER BUILDING COMPONENTS. 

USE OF THESE FACILITIES CANNOT RESUME UNTIL THE LIFE SAFETY CONCERNS AS

agency_project_description: Repairs and reconstruction of the bulkhead and pier at 107th Street and rehabiliation of esplanade.
delay_desc: PROJECT DELAYED DUE TO CHANGES IN SCOPE/DESIGN
scope_text: INSPECTIONS COMPLETED IN 2012 (AECOM) AND 2018 (PENNMAX) VIA EDC WFMMS INSPECTION PROGRAM. PHASE 4 CONTINUES WORK OF PRIOR PHASES, ADDRESSING ESPLANADE AREAS RATED AS CRITICAL. AREA 1 ADDRESSES 94TH TO 107TH($73.8M); AREA 2 ADDRESSES 118TH TO 124TH ($197.8M). THESE SECTIONS ADJOIN PHASES 2 & 3 AS WELL AS ESPLANADE WORK BEING PERFORMED BY EDC TO NORTH. THESE SECTIONS OF EESPLANADE ARE DISPLAYING PROGRESSIVE STRUCTURAL FAILURE WITH EXPANSIVE DETERIORATION OF SUPPORTING TIMBER SUBSTRUCTURES. COLLAPSE OF VARIOUS SECTIONS IS A NEAR-TERM POSSIBILITY. DPR HAS MADE PARTIAL AS WELL AS FULL PEDESTRIAN CLOSURES IN AREAS. PLEASE NOTE FUNDING REQUEST IS IN FY20 DOLLARS AND DOES NOT INCLUDE ESCALATION.

agency_project_description: Reconstruct the courts from the ground up. The asphalt pavement and aggregate base material will be removed. New aggregate base will be installed, compacted and graded. Following fine grading, a new asphalt surface will be laid in multiple lifts as is typical for tennis courts to ensure a consistently level playing surface. The final treatment will be a multi-coat liquid applied sports surface to provide the best playing experience in terms of ball bounce and traction.

scope_text:
"RECREATION CENTER 54 RECEIVED AN EMERGENCY DECLARATION FROM DOB ON 1/27/2020 (BACKUP ATTACHED) CALLING FOR THE EXPEDITED INSTALLATION OF ASIDEWALK SHED DUE TO THE SEVERITY OF THE UNSAFE CONDITION POSED BY THE REC CENTER FAADE, WHICH HAS BEEN PROVIDED.                      

THE CONDITION WHICH RESULTED IN THE EMERGENCYDECLARATION IS OUTSTANDING, AND NEEDS TO BE ADDRESSED IN ORDER TO REMOVE THE SIDEWALK SHED. AS CONDITION EXACERBATES OVER TIME, ADDITIONAL RISK TO PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY MAY BE IDENTIFIED RESULTING IN ADDITIONAL DOB EMERGENCY VIOLATIONS UNLESS THE FAADE IS REPAIRED.  

FUNDING IS REQUESTED TO REHABILITATE/RECONSTRUCT THE FAADE AT THE RECREATION CENTER IN ORDER TO ALLEVIATE THE UNSAFE CONDITION NOTED BY DOB AND EL

agency_project_description: The goal of the interior restoration is to preserve the intact historic fabric, including the distinctive woodpaneling in the living room, as well as the historic plaster and casing work. The project will address all ofthe interior spaces on the first and second floors, including the restoration of the kitchen - reinstallation ofthe floor and installation of new plaster finishes.The restoration will include the upgrading of all systems including the electrical and plumbing, as well asthe introduction of an HVAC system for improved climate control and greater public use/access of thehouse.Design will include investigation of structural issues (condition of the interior beams and framing) andinvestigation of potential contaminated/hazardous materials including lead paint and asbestos.
ten_year_plan_category: LARGE, MAJOR AND REGIONAL PARK RECONSTRUCTION

agency_project_description: This project will remove wooden groins and construct beach crossings at Rockaway Beach. This project is a pass-through to US Army Corps of Engineers, and will be managed by Mitchel Loring in Planning & Development.
delay_desc: PROJECT DELAYED DUE TO CHANGES IN SCOPE/DESIGN
scope_text: THE US ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS WILL BE CONSTRUCTING NEW GROINS ON ROCKAWAY BEACH IN THE SPRING OF 2020 TO CONTROL SAND EROSION. AT THE CITYS REQUEST, THE CORPS HAS AGREED TO INCLUDE THE REMOVAL OF DECAYING WOODEN GROINS IN A SECTION OF ROCKAWAY BEACH IN THEIR CONSTRUCTION PLANS, IF FUNDED BY THE CITY. THESE GROINS NO LONGER PROVIDE EROSION CONTROL AND COULD BE HAZARDOUS IF LEFT TO CONTINUE DECAYING. COUPLING THE GROIN REMOVAL WITH THE CORPS CONSTRUCTION OF NEW GROINS WILL PROVIDE A COST SAVINGS TO THE CITY.

agency_project_description: This project will reconstruct the roof at the Ocean Breeze Athletic Center.
ten_year_plan_category: LARGE, MAJOR AND REGIONAL PARK RECONSTRUCTION
delay_desc: PROJECT DELAYED DUE TO BUDGETARY CONSTRAINTS
scope_text: THE ROOF HAS BEEN ACTIVELY LEAKING SINCE BEFORE THE BUILDING WAS OPENED TO THE PUBLIC IN NOVEMBER 2015, AND THE LEAKS WERE PUNCH LISTED. WEWORKED WITH DDC FOR YEARS TO TRY TO RESOLVE THE ISSUE, BUT THE ROOFING SUBCONTRACTOR WENT OUT OF BUSINESS AND THE MANUFACTURER'S WARRANTY DID NOT COVER MARINE ENVIRONMENTS (SITE IS ACROSS THE STREET FROM THE BEACH). DDC HIRED A CONSULTANT TO INVESTIGATE THE LEAKS, AND THE REPORTWAS COMPLETED IN JUNE 2021.

agency_project_description: New education building at Queens Botanical Garden (QBG). Design and construction of a new 14,500 SF building to provide year-round programming and educational spaces to serve students, children, community gardeners, and others.The New Education Building will add six new teaching spaces, including four classrooms, a teaching kitchen and a teaching greenhouse where educators will be able to grow and maintain plants for educational purposes. Ideally, the four regular classrooms will be able to opened up into one large space to accommodate larger training programs.

agency_project_description: SIIAS - Building B at SHCC Phase1 Geothermal & Ground Floor
delay_desc: PROJECT DELAYED PENDING RESOLUTION OF LEGAL ISSUES
scope_text: SCOPE OF WORK IS THE INSTALLATION OF A GEO-THERMAL WELL FIELD WHICH WILL HEAT AND COOL BUILDING "B" AT SHCC. SCOPE OF WORK ALSO INCLUDES THE CONSTRUCTION OF NEW CLASSROOMS AND AN EXHIBITION PREPARATION ROOM/SHOP.

agency_project_description: Scope of WorkThe design intent is to complete an interior renovation of the Building with limited changes to the exterior envelope of the building. The renovation of Building B will serve as a partially climate controlled museum quality environment for the SIM Natural Science and collection and exhibitions, as follows. The work will include, but not limited to:A. New structural flooring system for basement floor on slab incorporating the archival compact storage mechanism.B. Drainage work to eliminate water infiltration.C. New elevator pit and shaft.D. New stairs to first floor.E. Restoration of existing finishes to remain. F. New partition layouts.G. New finishes.H. New electrical service and branch wiring.I. New mechanical and plumbing systems.

agency_project_description: C. MAJOR DESIGN CONSIDERATIONS1. When surveying existing conditions, special attention will be paid to current building loads, layouts, and resulting possible changes in power requirements.2. The existing chilling plant is composed of one chiller installed in approximately 1982, while one other large chiller and one small chiller are not functional. Mechanical equipment and distribution system was designed and specified as per requirement of more than 30 years ago. The centralized cooling equipment (chillers) located in Building L serve 5 other buildings  Buildings M, R, S, T & G (other buildings on site either have their own air conditioning system or use window units).3. In future phase, the Main Hall/Building C Newhouse Center for Contemporary Art and Building B-SIM Natural Sciences Collection which presently do not have any central air- conditioning system will be connected to the central cooling plant. Building C and Building B along with other buildings (M, R, S, T & G) must be taken into consideration while designing the chillers and calculating the total load.4. The Snug Harbor campus will remain operational during construction therefore a detailedconstruction scheduling will be considered as high priority. The project is anticipated to be constructed in two (2) phases: Phase 1  Replacement of main chiller for cooling system located at Building L, and study/assessment of HVAC (steam and chilled water) pipe distribution system connecting from Building L to all served buildings. Phase II  Replacement of all HVAC (cold and steam pipes) distribution system connecting from Building L to all served buildings. The exact scope of Phase II shall be determined on the assessment report submitted based on Phase I.
delay_desc: PROJECT DELAYED DUE TO UNFORESEEN SITE/FIELD CONDITION
scope_text: SITE-WIDE HVAC UPGRADE FOR SNUG HARBOR CAMPUS, INCLUDING COMPLETE REPLACEMENT OF EQUIPMENT AT THE CENTRAL BOILER AND COOLING PLANT (BUILDING L) AND THE UPGRADE AND CONNECTION OF SYSTEMS AT THE 12 BUILDINGS SERVED BY THE CENTRAL PLANT.

delay_desc: PROJECT DELAYED DUE TO UNFORESEEN SITE/FIELD CONDITION
scope_text: SITE-WIDE HVAC UPGRADE FOR SNUG HARBOR CAMPUS, INCLUDING COMPLETE REPLACEMENT OF EQUIPMENT AT THE CENTRAL BOILER AND COOLING PLANT (BUILDING L) AND THE UPGRADE AND CONNECTION OF SYSTEMS AT THE 12 BUILDINGS SERVED BY THE CENTRAL PLANT.

agency_project_description: C. MAJOR DESIGN CONSIDERATIONS1. When surveying existing conditions, special attention will be paid to current building loads, layouts, and resulting possible changes in power requirements.2. The existing chilling plant is composed of one chiller installed in approximately 1982, while one other large chiller and one small chiller are not functional. Mechanical equipment and distribution system was designed and specified as per requirement of more than 30 years ago. The centralized cooling equipment (chillers) located in Building L serve 5 other buildings  Buildings M, R, S, T & G (other buildings on site either have their own air conditioning system or use window units).3. In future phase, the Main Hall/Building C Newhouse Center for Contemporary Art and Building B-SIM Natural Sciences Collection which presently do not have any central air- conditioning system will be connected to the central cooling plant. Building C and Building B along with other buildings (M, R, S, T & G) must be taken into consideration while designing the chillers and calculating the total load.4. The Snug Harbor campus will remain operational during construction therefore a detailedconstruction scheduling will be considered as high priority. The project is anticipated to be constructed in two (2) phases: Phase 1  Replacement of main chiller for cooling system located at Building L, and study/assessment of HVAC (steam and chilled water) pipe distribution system connecting from Building L to all served buildings. Phase II  Replacement of all HVAC (cold and steam pipes) distribution system connecting from Building L to all served buildings. The exact scope of Phase II shall be determined on the assessment report submitted based on Phase I.

agency_project_description: The scope of work consists of providing all necessary construction management, design, andr.onstruction services required to perform ail phases of the project: Surveying, tank testing,investigation, design, construction, and construction management for the closure, removal, upgrade,or replacement of petroieum product storage tanks at various City owned sites. This work mustcomply with all local, state, nnd federal laws nnd regulations governing tanks and associated work.The general scope of work for tank replacement includes:File NYSDEC PBS application; mobilization; securing all required NYC agency approvals & permits;site survey; geophysical survey; drilling for laboratory soil and groundwater samples; crane & rigging;saw cutting; demo & disposal of old tanks, piping, and concrete vaults; dewatering of excavation; tankbottom sludge removal & disposal; remove/transfer/dispose product; laboratory analysis of soil andgroundwater; excavate, remove, dispose incidental contaminated soil; install shoring, new tanks andtank sumps, piping, monitoring and leak detection system, overfill protection and alarms, electricalwiring; construction of concrete slabs and block piers; backfill excavation; resurfacing; demobilization;performance of a closeout investigation and the preparation and filing of appropriate reports;obtaining FDNY and DOB closeout documents; preparing "As-built" drawings.
ten_year_plan_category: LEGAL MANDATES AND CORRECTION OF UNSAFE CONDITIONS
delay_desc: PROJECT DELAYED DUE TO BUDGETARY CONSTRAINTS

This work mustcomply with all local, state, nnd federal laws nnd regulations governing tanks and associated work.The general scope of work for tank replacement includes:File NYSDEC PBS application; mobilization; securing all required NYC agency approvals & permits;site survey; geophysical survey; drilling for laboratory soil and groundwater samples; crane & rigging;saw cutting; demo & disposal of old tanks, piping, and concrete vaults; dewatering of excavation; tankbottom sludge removal & disposal; remove/transfer/dispose product; laboratory analysis of soil andgroundwater; excavate, remove, dispose incidental contaminated soil; install shoring, new tanks andtank sumps, piping, monitoring and leak detection system, overfill protection and alarms, electricalwiring; construction of concrete slabs and block piers; backfill excavation; resurfacing; demobilization;performance of a closeout investigation and the preparation and filing of appropriate reports;obtaining FDNY and DOB closeout documents; preparing "As-built" drawings.

agency_project_description: Removal and restoration of Queens Borough Hall Plaza main entrance including sloped entryway on Queens Blvd, court house entryway on northeast side of building, and rear building egress at the parking lot. Scope includes installation of automatic doors at main entrance, removal and replacement of handrails and plaza stair treads. Removal and replacement of retaining wall near court house entryway, removal and replacement of stair treads leading down to lower level, and removal and replacement of sidewalk leading from Queens Blvd to court house entryway. Removal and replacement of two stairways leading into the building from the parking, handrails and adjacent walkways along with 5-10' of pavement on either side.

agency_project_description: The Department of Sanitation of the City of New York (DSNY) is planning to rehabilitate Queens Districts 11 and 13 garage. The renovation serving both districts is to extend the useful life of the facility through rehabilitation of the building structure and systems. The renovation includes: Extensive structural work that includes the replacement of reinforced concrete slabs and stiffening of the existing steel frame, select replacement of building MEP systems, including BMS systems, architectural renovation of the entire building, study and implementation of deep energy conservation measures (DECMs), and site work which includes new landscape work and replacement of sidewalks and driveways. Rehabilitation is required to meet LEED Silver requirements.
delay_desc: PROJECT DELAYED DUE TO CHANGES IN SCOPE/DESIGN

agency_project_description: Design services for the creation of beach access and repair or constuction of necessary park facilities in areas damaged by Storm Sandy. The scope of the design work includes: architecture, engineering (mechanical, environmental, structural), landscape architecture and graphic design services for multiple locations. agency_project_description: This project has been initiated to bring three identified utility trenches in SI to a state of good repair. These sites, pulled from a master list, were prioritized with attention to ratings data, field observations, and community needs. The sites are split into scoping categories; full street reconstruction, and trench restoration with resurfacing. Projects will upgrade pedestrian facilities to ADA compliancy, and address adjacent capital assets in poor condition (curbs, sidewalks, and others as needed). SER002333 IS A SUB-PROJECT TO HWTRR1.

agency_project_description: The retaining wall along the segment of Pratt Avenue (Needham Ave to Dead End) shows multiple signs of damage. This includes cracking (long cracks run the entire height of the wall) and movement of the individual elements of the wall. The cracks and movement of the wall has allowed the backfill that supports the roadway to escape. The roadway within the project limits has experienced significant damage due to settlement of supporting materials. The proposed scope includes reconstruction of the roadway and retaining wall along this segment.
